tests.title: Fetch the details of music legends
tests.desc:
We have a database of music artists.

Some of them are considered 'legends', and so we want to create a component to display their details using REST API.

tests.title: Display a list of important people
tests.desc:
We'd like to display a list of relevant people from different countries.

We have a couple of endpoints:

- `/rest/important-people`: returns a list of `id` of relevant people.

- `/rest/important-people/<id>`: returns the details (name and relevance rank) of the person represented by the `id`.

tests.title: Get the Brexit deal!
tests.desc: By popular demand, we've been asked to  create a component to display the details of the Brexit deal.

tests.title: Show Paul Verhoeven masterpieces
tests.desc:
We love Paul Verhoeven, probably one of the greatest (and underrated) directors of Hollywood movies in history.

Let's pay tribute by displaying a list of relevant movies, organised by genre.

tests.title: Create a cool words search engine
tests.desc:
All writers love language. And we especially love fun words, donâ€™t we? 

Please create a mechanism to search & display cool words.

tests.title: Log component lifecycle
tests.desc:
We want to intercept some of the React lifecycle methods, by providing a log mechanism with 2 levels of sensitivity:

- `INFO`
- `WARN`

tests.title: Mastering DOM manipulation
tests.desc:
We want to prove how good we are manipulating DOM elements.

Please add a label and a button to the React component; return the former when the latter is clicked.

After each click, the label is expected to have a `key-${x}=value=${x}` attribute on it.

Please make sure the `key-${x-1}=value=${x-1}` one is deleted after each click on the button.

tests.title: Display a form with a button in it
tests.desc:
We have a `Form`, and we'd like to add a `Button` to it.

The problem seems simple to solve, until we realise we have to deal with `props` of the `children` components!

tests.title: Add an item to the cart!
tests.desc:
We got a well deserved salary of 1%. To celebrate that, we'd like to do some online shopping. 

We haven't found any digital store good enough to satisfy or demanding requirements, so we've decided to build one by ourselves!

tests.title: Callback hell!
tests.desc:
The so called 'callback hell' is a classic problem is async programming, making the code hard to read and (specially) maintain.

Let's orchestrate some messaging across a bunch of components to making sure we can deal with it.

tests.title: Create a routing system for our portfolio
tests.desc: We want to introduce a routing system, to redirect the users to the corresponding view depending on the current URL.

tests.title: Create a movies app
tests.desc:
We want to create a new app to display movies by genre.

We'd like to manage 4 view, for the time view:

- Home
- Genres home
- Romance movies
- Drama movies

tests.title: Create the structure of a Portfolio App
tests.desc:
We know how important the portfolio is to break into the market. Please create an app with 3 views:

- Home (To navigate to Portfolio)
- Portfolio (To navigate to About)

Even though `react-router-dom` offers the `Link` component, we're not allowed to importing it here, so you are expected to create it by yourself. Please encapsulate an `a` tag that, on click, pushes the target url to the `history` object passed by `Route`.

tests.title: Display country details
tests.desc: We have a countries database, and we'd like to create an app to display the details of each nation.

tests.title: Create a racing database app
tests.desc:
We've spent a while collecting data from different competitions (F1 and MotoGP) and years (since 1971 to 2006).

Please determine, based on the current URL, whether the combination of competition + year is available on the system or not.

tests.title: Captain Tsubasa!
tests.desc:
If you were born in the 80s or before, you probably remember Captain Tsubasa, one of the greatest Japanese anime in history.

To pay a sort of tribute, we'd like to create a players database, to display details such as the name and the position of the legends.

tests.title: Create a walkman component :)
tests.desc:
The 90's are cool again!

We've found a cassette tape, and we'd like to implement a 'walkman-like' mechanism to:

1) Check which side is active
2) Check the content of the active side
3) Toggle the active side

tests.title: Eurovision contest is back!
tests.desc:
We know you can't wait until the next Eurovision contest, which clearly is the most important cultural event in The Old Continent.

On render, we'd like to simulate data fetching from the backend (by displaying a loading message) and, after half a second, then please show some results.

tests.title: Word of mouth can be dangerous!
tests.desc:
Word of mouth or viva voce, is the passing of information from person to person by oral communication.

Some people says that's the best way to e.g. promote a business, but it has some risks too, as e.g. info can easily be distorted.

tests.title: Mark an email as read
tests.desc:
We are creating a new, shiny email client.

We'd like to add a button to mark all the emails as read, in one go.

tests.title: Display a message from the component state
tests.desc:
Let's play with the state!

This mechanism is vital in React towards maintaining your UI up to date.

The requested steps are:

1) Create a `state` as part of the `constructor` method (don't forget to invoke `super`!
2) Display the created property of the state into the `render` method

tests.title: Display the average score of a player
tests.desc:
We want to know what's the score of a given player.

In that respect, our component will maintain two state properties:

- `firstScore`
- `secondScore`

Please display the rounded average score.

tests.title: Display the average score of a player after completing a challenge
tests.desc:
We want to know what's the score of a given player, after completing a challenge.

In that respect, our component will maintain two state properties:

- `firstScore`
- `secondScore`

Additionally, we also want to incorporate to the calculation the newly obtained score, passed as a new prop to the component, called `newScore`.

Please display the rounded average score.

tests.title: Perform some math operations
tests.desc:
We have a component with a couple of state props on it, `a` & `b`

We're also passing a prop, `operation`, to decide whether we want to add or subtract them.

We'd also like to display an error if the passed operation is not supported yet.

tests.title: Add new element to state
tests.desc:
We have a component with two state numbers, `a` and `b`. We're also providing a third one as a prop, `c`.

We'd like to add a new state number, `total`, with the result of adding them all (`a` + `b` + `c`).

tests.title: Sign In form
tests.desc:
We'd like to create a login form, with two fields: `email` and `password`.

The `submit` button will be enabled once both fields are valid.

tests.title: Reset password form
tests.desc:
Ooops, we've forgotten our password!

No problem at all, let's create a form to reset it :)

tests.title: Is my username available?
tests.desc:
There are 4.4 billion internet users in the world. Our favourite username is likely to be taken by someone else already!

On a given platform, please check whether it's available or not, based on:

1) A list of existing usernames
2) A list of forbidden usernames

tests.title: Create a beer online store
tests.desc:
We love beer, specially Alhambra 1925...so hard to find!

We're creating an online store to sell beers. On sign up, our customers have to prove the are, at least, 18 years old by performing a couple of checks.

tests.title: Create an evil Sign In form
tests.desc:
We want to introduce a new type of sign in form, that swaps the tokens (name <-> domain) of the given email address.

Oh! for security reasons, remember to encode the password into base-64.

tests.title: Display an input field
tests.desc: As simple as that. Please display a controlled input field, which means we want to track changes via `setState`.

tests.title: Display the expected salary of a player
tests.desc: We want to give our players the opportunity to share, if they want and only with selected stakeholders, what are their professional salary expectations, so they can be contacted with relevant job positions.

tests.title: Clear input with button
tests.desc:
We'd like to display an input field with some value on it.

Apart from that, we want to show a button nearby, to allow resetting the input (that means, to set an empty value on it).

tests.title: Check if email inputs match
tests.desc:
In the old times, registering an email was easy peasy.

Today, however, the majority of the addresses have been already taken, hence it's sometimes challenging to pick -and remember!- a decent one.

Please create a 2-input component, to set and review user's email address.

tests.title: Pick a piece of fruit!
tests.desc:
One apple a day keeps the doctor away.

At Kodiri, we believe & promote a healthy way of life, by e.g. organising sport competitions (yes, table tennis is a sport, and you can even sweat from time to time).

Apart from that, we are planning to offer free fruit to our employees. We'd like to create an online platform to give them the chance to select which type of fruit do they want to pick each time.

tests.title: Get a welcome message
tests.desc:
Simply create a function to return the following message: `Welcome to React`

Please note React is case sensitive :)

tests.title: Get a welcome message, in two paragraphs
tests.desc:
Create a function to return the following message: `Welcome to React`

Please split the message into two separatedparagraphs (using the `p` tag):

- Welcome
- to React

tests.title: Dealing with classNames
tests.desc:
We want to introduce a new component (`BasketballStar`) to display some details about some legendary basketball players.

We'd like to add a `className` attribute to the first name and last name props, for styling purposes.

tests.title: Mixing selectors
tests.desc:
We're trying to define a new React component to display the details of our last order:

- Book Id
- Title
- Author

A colleague started to work on it today, but he left early to play table tennis.

Could you please complete it?

tests.title: Dealing with nested selectors
tests.desc:
We'd like to create a new component to display the match results on the Premier League.

The structure of the component is:

* `.fixtures`
    * `.fixture`
        * `.team1`
        * `.team2`
        * `.result`

tests.title: Welcome a given user
tests.desc: We want to create a `Welcome` component to say 'hello' to a given user

tests.title: Display details of US presidents
tests.desc: We're creating a mobile app to display some basic information about former presidents of the US.

tests.title: Show player details
tests.desc: By popular demand, we'd like to introduce a new view into the platform to displaying the average score of a given user.

tests.title: Analyse scores
tests.desc:
Please create a component to display basic details of a given list of scores:

- Number of received scores
- First score
- Second score

You can assume each list contains, at least, two elements.

tests.title: Display the total score
tests.desc: We are planning to create a new component to display the accumulated score of a given player.

tests.title: Welcome users
tests.desc:
We'd like to display a welcome message to our customers, according to the following criteria:

- If the `lastName` is provided -> display `Welcome Mr lastName`
- If not -> display `Welcome firstName`

tests.title: Create a ticketing system
tests.desc:
We'd like to introduce a new online system to allow users buying tickets for their favourite shows.

The only exception is: they should be at least 18 years old to proceed!
tests.resources: [How to use the conditional operator in JavaScript?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6259982/how-do-you-use-the-conditional-operator-in-javascript)

tests.title: Evaluate challenge results
tests.desc:
Please create a new component to determine how good the challenge results of a given user are.

It'd be great to reuse the existing `getAverage` function, so:

- If it returns >= 50 -> display `Well done!`
-If it returns < 50 -> display `Keep training!`
tests.resources: [How to use the conditional operator in JavaScript?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6259982/how-do-you-use-the-conditional-operator-in-javascript)

tests.title: How good a film is?
tests.desc:
We'd like to evaluate how good a given film is depending on its average score on the internet:

- <50: Poor
- >=50 && < 75: Nice
- >= 75: Excellent

tests.title: Purchase dance club tickets
tests.desc:
A new posh club is opening in town.

We'd like to create a ticketing system for our customers.

In that respect, we'd like to introduce some age-related restrictions:

- If the age is at least 18, then users are allowed to purchase tickets.
- If the age is below 18, users are allowed to purchase tickets IF the selected session is on the afternoon (alcohol-free)

tests.title: Display a list of actor names
tests.desc: Simply display a list of actors :)

tests.title: Display a list of actor details
tests.desc:
We have a list of actors, and we'd like to display their details:

- name
- age

tests.title: Display a list of Formula 1 World Champions
tests.desc:
We have a large database of Formula 1 drivers, from legends like Ayrton Senna or Michael Schumacher to some others like Luca Badoer or Alex Yoong.

We'd like to display a list of World Champions!

tests.title: Display the details of a given user
tests.resources:
[Getting the keys of an object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/keys)
[Using the bracket notation with objects](https://codeburst.io/javascript-quickie-dot-notation-vs-bracket-notation-333641c0f781)
tests.desc:
We are trying to display the details of a given user.

There's an issue, though. We don't know which properties are available each time!

tests.title: Reverse starting grid
tests.desc:
Formula 1 is loosing spectators year after year.

To improve the show, the organisers are thinking about reversing the given entry list of teams, so which ever was supposed to start last will be promoted to the head of the queue, and vice-versa.

tests.title: Display a basic input text
tests.desc:
We'd like to display a basic input text, including:

- A default value
- A placeholder (that is, the text we display when the input is blank)

tests.title: Display an input text with dynamic data
tests.desc:
We're trying to create a dynamic input text component, by passing different properties to it each time:

- A default value
- A placeholder (that is, the text we display when the input is blank)

tests.title: Display a textarea with dynamic data
tests.desc:
We're trying to create a dynamic textarea component, by passing different properties to it each time:

- A default value
- A placeholder (that is, the text we display when the input is blank)

tests.title: Display checkboxes on a sign up form
tests.desc:
Let's talk about checkboxes!

As part of our sign up form, we'd like to display, at the bottom, a couple of ticks to confirm whether the user:

1) Accepts the terms and conditions
2) Accepts to receive a monthly newsletter.

We'd like to customise the default values for these checkbox on each case.

tests.title: Display a combo to select a piece of fruit
tests.desc:
As part of our new diet, our nutritionist has suggested us to eat more fruit, unsurprisingly. She's particularly interested on apples and oranges.

Let's display a dropdown to pick a piece of fruit, with the ability of showing a different default element each time.

tests.title: Press the button!
tests.desc: We simply want to create a component with a single button on it, so its text will reflect whether it's been pressed at least once or not.

tests.title: Toggle driver details
tests.desc: We are creating a racing database, and we'd like to toggle the details of a given driver when clicking on a button near to his/her name.

tests.title: Submit a request
tests.desc:
When completing a form, it sometimes takes a while to complete the request and display some results to the user.

To improve the UX, we'd like to display a 'submitting' message on the CTA button while the request is being processed.

Please simulate the completion of the request after, exactly, 1s from being invoked.

tests.title: Reseting user's password
tests.desc:
Sometimes users forget their passwords, so we'd like to create a functionality to handle the situation it by sending an email to reset it.

To avoid multiple requests being submitted multiple times, please disable all the inputs until the process finishes in, exactly, half a second.

tests.title: Create a Chess game
tests.desc:
We'd like to revive some of the greatest Chess games in history.

Let's create a game that assigns player to Black (top position) and White (bottom position).

Please add a button to swap sides, so every player can play with both Black and White.

tests.title: Display a list of movies
tests.desc: We are creating a movie database, and we'd like to display a list of titles in a user-friendly format.

tests.title: Display a list of female tennis players
tests.desc:
We want to create a component to display a list of professional female tennis players.

Please sort the results alphabetically!

tests.title: Display a filtered list of countries
tests.desc:
There are lots of countries in the world.

Have you ever heard about Saint Kitts and Nevis? It's one of them indeed.

We'd like to display a list of nations, with a filter mechanism to decide which ones are visible each time.

tests.title: Display a list of music artists
tests.desc:
We want to display a list of music artists, both bands and individuals.

In some cases, we'd like to display additional details. For now, these are represented by their first Album, but in the future we plan to incorporate extra info (e.g. how old they are).

tests.title: Nested list, e.g. players with score and date and level
tests.desc: Let's show the final position of some Formula 1 drivers at the end of certain seasons.
